Commit messages

Last updated on November 20, 2022

Commit messages

In my travels across the Internet, I frequently find myself peaking into the code bases of websites I come across. If I’m lucky, it’s code I understand and that I can use for my own project. If I’m even luckier, the person who wrote the code leaves a funny trail of the experience they had writing the code.

When I’m working with a new framework or programming language, I sometimes feel isolated and silly for not knowing how one thing or another might work. Reading these commit messages makes me feel better about the state of the world.

  • Stage this thanks Jesus Christ
  • Echt een geweldig vak, kutzooi by Ben Lieven (“Real loving this class, bullshit”)
  • fucking finally fuck me I hate jekyll already by Victor Sonck
  • Annuleer heel de kutzooi maar by willemLegend27 (“Just cancel the whole fucking thing”)
  • Yesssss its even responsive by Maggie Appleton
  • had one goddamn charachter wrong, oh my god help me by Vivian
  • People have zero knowledge of the language they translate to ffs by MonAx

Zinzy Waleson Geene (she/ they) is a researcher, designer, and queer facilitator from Amsterdam. She's interested in humanities and behavioral sciences, yoga practice, and amateur cooking. She engages in mellow cultural and critical analysis, linking and tinkering on her personal website, zinzy.website .
